chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
Equivalence equiv

Premises:
Record Equivalence (A : Type) (R : relation A) : Prop := Build_Equivalence { Equivalence_Reflexive : Reflexive R; Equivalence_Symmetric : Symmetric R; Equivalence_Transitive : Transitive R } Arguments Equivalence {A}%type_scope Arguments Build_Equivalence {A}%type_scope
Inductive equiv : term -> term -> Prop := eqStep : forall s t : term, s ≻ t -> s == t | eqRef : forall s : term, s == s | eqSym : forall s t : term, t == s -> s == t | eqTrans : forall s t u : term, s == t -> t == u -> s == u Arguments eqStep [s t] Arguments eqSym [s t] Arguments eqTrans [s t u]
Ring_theory.C_setoid : forall (C : Type) (ceq : C -> C -> Prop), Equivalence ceq -> Equivalence ceq
Pos.eq_equiv = eq_equivalence : Equivalence eq
N.eq_equiv = eq_equivalence : Equivalence eq
Z.eq_equiv = eq_equivalence : Equivalence eq
Nat.eq_equiv = eq_equivalence : Equivalence eq
Ring_polynom.Pequiv_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall (C : Type) (phi : C -> R), Equivalence (Ring_polynom.Pequiv rO radd rmul req phi)
Ring_theory.Eqsth : forall R : Type, Equivalence eq
Zdiv.eqm_setoid : forall N : Z, Equivalence (Zdiv.eqm N)
equi_Equivalence : forall X : Type, Equivalence (equi (X:=X))
Ndigits.eqf_equiv = Build_Equivalence Ndigits.eqf Equivalence_Reflexive Equivalence_Symmetric Equivalence_Transitive : Equivalence Ndigits.eqf
Ring_theory.C_setoid_Symmetric : forall (C : Type) (ceq : C -> C -> Prop), Equivalence ceq -> Symmetric ceq
Ring_theory.C_setoid_Transitive : forall (C : Type) (ceq : C -> C -> Prop), Equivalence ceq -> Transitive ceq
Ring_theory.C_setoid_Reflexive : forall (C : Type) (ceq : C -> C -> Prop), Equivalence ceq -> Reflexive ceq
ecl_Equivalence : forall R : ?X -> ?X -> Prop, Equivalence (ecl R) where ?X : [ |- Type]
Field_theory.R_setoid3 : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid_Theory R req -> Equivalence req
InitialRing.R_setoid3 : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid_Theory R req -> Equivalence req
InitialRing.R_setoid4 : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid_Theory R req -> Equivalence req
InitialRing.R_setoid5 : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid_Theory R req -> Equivalence req
InitialRing.R_set1 : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid_Theory R req -> Equivalence req
Build_Setoid_Theory : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A), Reflexive R -> Symmetric R -> Transitive R -> Equivalence R
Field_theory.NPEequiv_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R), Equivalence (Field_theory.NPEequiv rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow)
Ring_theory.pow_N_th : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.power_theory rI rmul req Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul)
Ring_theory.pow_N_pow_N : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall (x : R) (n : N), req (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul x (Ring_theory.id_phi_N n)) (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul x n)
Ring_theory.SRth_ARth : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.semi_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req
OrderedRing.sor_setoid : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> Equivalence req
RingMicromega.micomega_sor_setoid : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> Equivalence req
ZCoeff.sor_setoid : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> Equivalence req
Ring_theory.ARmul_0_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul x rO) rO
QArith_base.Q_Setoid = Build_Equivalence QArith_base.Qeq (fun x : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qeq_refl x) (fun (x y : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) => QArith_base.Qeq_sym x y H) (fun (x y z : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) (H0 : QArith_base.Qeq y z) => QArith_base.Qeq_trans x y z H H0) : Equivalence QArith_base.Qeq
Ring_theory.ARopp_zero : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> req (ropp rO) rO
Field_theory.SF2AF : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Field_theory.semi_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rdiv rinv req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) rdiv rinv req
EnvRing.rsub_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rsub
Ring_polynom.rsub_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rsub
Ring_theory.Rth_ARth : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
N.eqf_equiv = Build_Equivalence N.eqf (fun (x : N -> bool) (n : N) => eq_refl) (fun (x y : N -> bool) (H : N.eqf x y) => SYM1 H) (fun (x y z : N -> bool) (H : N.eqf x y) (H0 : N.eqf y z) (n : N) => eq_trans (H n) (H0 n)) : Equivalence N.eqf
Nat.eqf_equiv = Build_Equivalence Nat.eqf (fun (x : nat -> bool) (n : nat) => eq_refl) (fun (x y : nat -> bool) (H : Nat.eqf x y) => SYM1 H) (fun (x y z : nat -> bool) (H : Nat.eqf x y) (H0 : Nat.eqf y z) (n : nat) => eq_trans (H n) (H0 n)) : Equivalence Nat.eqf
Z.eqf_equiv = Build_Equivalence Z.eqf (fun (x : Z -> bool) (n : Z) => eq_refl) (fun (x y : Z -> bool) (H : Z.eqf x y) => SYM1 H) (fun (x y z : Z -> bool) (H : Z.eqf x y) (H0 : Z.eqf y z) (n : Z) => eq_trans (H n) (H0 n)) : Equivalence Z.eqf
Field_theory.rsub_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rsub
Field_theory.F2AF : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req
EnvRing.rsub_ext : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req x y -> forall x0 y0 : R, req x0 y0 -> req (rsub x x0) (rsub y y0)

```intros. apply Build_Equivalence.
- apply Equivalence_Reflexive.
- apply Equivalence_Symmetric.
- apply Equivalence_Transitive.```

original: intros. apply Build_Equivalence. - apply Equivalence_Reflexive. - apply Equivalence_Symmetric. - apply Equivalence_Transitive.
